label: 松平清康
本: The Cambridge History of Japan, Volume 4:  Early Modern Japan . Cambridge University Press . 1991
説明文: (1511-35) Tokugawa ancestor.  In 1524 [he] consolidated his position by pulling back to the east of the Yahagi river, adopting the castle of Okazaki as his headquarters.  This castle was to serve the Matsudaira on and off until Ieyasu's time (p. 133). [徳川、矢作川、岡崎、家康]
